title: 111_s3505
content: The Act may be cited as the "China Fair Trade Act of 2010" and focuses on reciprocal competitive trade practices. The Trade Agreements Act of 1979 is amended to include exceptions for procurements where there are no offers of US products/services or if the offers are insufficient. A special rule exempts procurements from the People's Republic of China. The Trade Agreements Act of 1979 is amended to include exceptions for procurements from the People's Republic of China. SEC. 3. REQUIREMENTS TO BUY CERTAIN ITEMS FROM AMERICAN SOURCES. The Buy American Act is amended to require American materials for public use, with exceptions for articles from China until they join the Agreement on Government Procurement. Contract specifications are also updated. The Buy American Act is amended to require American materials for public use, with exceptions for articles from China until they join the Agreement on Government Procurement. Defense contracts for certain articles from China are also addressed in the amendments. The Buy American Act is amended to require American materials for public use, with exceptions for articles from China until they join the Agreement on Government Procurement. The exceptions in subsections (c) through (h) shall not apply to items from China until they become a party to the Agreement on Government Procurement. The Buy American Act is amended to require American materials for public use, with exceptions for articles from China until they join the Agreement on Government Procurement as described in section 101(d)(17) of the Uruguay Round Agreements Act. The Secretary of Commerce must submit a report to Congress on China's industrial sectors' productive capacity within 180 days. The report will assess any actions taken by the Chinese government to modify the sectors' capacity. Additionally, there will be a report on subsidies provided by China for renewable energy products and technology. The Secretary of Energy, in consultation with other agencies, must report to Congress on China's policies and subsidies for renewable energy products within 180 days. The report will analyze the impact on US manufacturers. Definitions for "renewable energy" and "renewable energy product or technology" are provided. The term "renewable energy resource" includes solar, wind, ocean, tidal, hydrokinetic, geothermal energy, biofuel, biomass, hydropower, and other resources determined by the Secretary of Energy.
